results.title: The Age of change
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Looks at the impact of technological change on the Melbourne newspaper ‘The Age’ and considers this change in terms of its effect on the people involved. Highlights the increasing competition at the desk of reporters and editors from electronic information systems, and the impact of technology on the once labour-intensive area of printing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: Rabbit Control [Part 1: Poisoning with 1080]
results.creator_credit: Ian Blythman, John Atkins and Conservation Forests and Lands
results.brief_description: This program narrated by Maurie Fields shows the problem of pest control in rural Victoria, and the adverse effects on farming if rabbit populations are not controlled. Part 1 explains the proper steps and procedure in using the poison 1080, the various safety precautions, equipment and supplies and tidy up details.

results.title: The Punter
results.brief_description: A short film about Jack Burnett and his involvment in the horse racing industry in the 1970s. (Jack is the father-in-law of the filmmaker) Identifiable with many students. Could be used for discussion on the idea of bought leisure and deals with gambling relating to horse racing.

results.title: Keith's story
results.brief_description: Although now struggling with Alzheimer’s disease, the stories of Keith’s achievements and adventures as told by his wife are a tribute to his inspirational life. Created as part of ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ in association with Vic Health and the Alzheimer’s Association.

results.title: 3 good reasons
results.brief_description: David Hunt is a volunteer for the Heart Foundation. He speaks of his own personal tragedies and how these particular events have motivated him to dedicate his time to the Heart Foundation. Made as part of ‘The Heart of the Story’ in association with Vic Health and the Heart Foundation.

results.title: The Heart Foundation
results.brief_description: After losing his father to a heart attack when he was young, Andrew Tonkin dedicated his life to researching heart disease. This is his story of his own experiences with the Heart Foundation. Made as part of ‘The Heart of the Story’ in association with Vic Health and the Heart Foundation.

results.title: The Irrepressible Jack Stone
results.brief_description: A heartbreaking but inspiring story about Jack Stone, the kid who lived every moment of his life to the fullest - as told by his mother. Created as part of ‘The Heart of the Story’, an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with the National Heart Foundation of Australia (Victorian Division) in partnership with VicHealth. You can create your won Digital Story. Ask at the Information Desk or go to www.acmi.net.au/digitalstorytelling

results.title: The Day Before I Went Away
results.creator_credit: Guo Jian, ACMI and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: Guo Jian’s saucy and sinister reappropriation of Chinese propaganda painting techniques is heightened by this animation of his allegorical work ‘The Day Before I Went Away’.

results.title: Gel
results.creator_credit: Ralph Henderson, Eric White and Films Sagittaire
results.brief_description: Produced for the Davis Gelatine company, the film uses a domestic science student to outline some of the properties and uses of gelatine. Various examples of modern gelatine cookery are also shown.

results.title: You've changed
results.brief_description: From the time he was awarded a Churchill Fellowship in 1969, Conrad’s life has been one of achievement. A skilled builder, a respected intellect and an icon in forestry aviation, Conrad now needs full-time care due to dementia. Created as part of ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ in association with Vic Health and the Alzheimer’s Association.
